<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brew’s MacBook Pro giveaway is back and better than ever, which is to say the same as ever, which is to say stop with the theatrics and just give us the laptops already. <strong style="color:#000">How it works: </strong></p>

<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Economy: </strong></span><span>Senate Republicans released their $1 trillion emergency relief package, and since you have to brand everything these days, they called it the </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-congress/u-s-republicans-offer-coronavirus-aid-plan-face-bipartisan-opposition-idUSKCN24S148?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">HEALS Act</a></span><span>. It contains another round of $1,200 in direct payments and reduced additional unemployment benefits from the current $600/week. Keep in mind, it’s just a starting point for negotiations with Democrats. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Coronavirus: </strong></span><span>Infections appear to be </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-26/u-s-hot-spots-get-reprieve-from-climbing-cases-virus-update?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slowing</a></span><span> in a few key states that have experienced major outbreaks: California, Florida, and Arizona.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Currency: </strong></span><span>The U.S. dollar </span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/heres-what-a-falling-us-dollar-means-for-the-stock-market-2020-07-25?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell</a></span><span> to a two-year low yesterday. It’s tough to know what to make of that relative to stocks, which have been gaining as the dollar has dropped, but it likely means investors are less bullish on the U.S. economy than other countries.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/google-extends-remote-policy-july-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Google’s Gonna Give It a Year
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Google logo on a couch" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODc1L2dvb2dsZV9sb2dvX29uX2FfY291Y2guanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google is letting employees <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-to-keep-employees-home-until-summer-2021-amid-coronavirus-pandemic-11595854201?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">remain remote</a> until July 2021, a decision that will affect ~200,000 full-time and contract workers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Besides saving a small fortune on KIND Bars, CEO Sundar Pichai wanted to provide flexibility for working parents who may need to provide childcare this fall, and relocating employees who want to sign full-year leases in their mountain/beach town of choice. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twitter and Facebook committed to a more permanent remote workforce months ago, but Google is the first major company to extend its WFH timeline due to the resurgence in cases. And it won’t be the last. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Bad news for business districts</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While NYC reopened offices for nonessential workers a month ago, fewer than 10% of Manhattan button-ups <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/one-month-later-few-manhattan-office-workers-have-returned-despite-new-yorks-reopening-11595847600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are back</a>, per the WSJ. That emptiness feels especially profound in districts <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/26/nyregion/nyc-coronavirus-time-life-building.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">like Midtown</a>, where offices that once welcomed 8,000 people/day now host just 500.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And when workers are home...they’re not spending money at Potbelly after giving up on the Sweetgreen line. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">About a fourth of New York's office employers plan on reducing their office footprint by 20% or more, according to a Partnership for New York City study. Big cities’ losses could be a gain for small cities that have historically taken longer to recover from downturns. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Still, don’t bank on a mass exodus. </strong>Most office leases are 8+ years, and many employers are trying hybrid approaches where employees still come in a couple days a week.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A tempting alternative: According to the WSJ, video communications company OpenExchange is </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/companies-start-to-think-remote-work-isnt-so-great-after-all-11595603397?mod=searchresults&page=1&pos=2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">renting a house</a></span><span> in the English countryside for its European employees to live and work out of. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Cracks in the remote model</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While many companies went remote relatively smoothly, some execs are feeling cool about it long-term.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hiring and onboarding are more choppy. Company values are harder to instill remotely. Young employees are missing out on development and mentorship. And Justin has completely given up on hiding his pen during Zoom meetings.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Remote work also makes it more difficult for employers to root out bad behavior and ensure client confidentiality.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>other companies’ decisions could turn on the status of school reopenings and how quickly the recent spike in COVID-19 cases subsides.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/whats-whats-gold-toy-sales-trending-different-directions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Up</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Operation Warp Speed: </strong>Yesterday, biotech company Moderna and the National Institutes of Health began one of the <a href="cnn.com/2020/07/27/health/coronavirus-vaccine-trial-begins-moderna-phase-3/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first large studies</a> of a coronavirus vaccine in the U.S. They plan to eventually enroll 30,000 people at nearly 100 sites; the results could come by November. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Precious metals: </strong>Gold futures hit an <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/gold-all-time-high-price-today-2020-07-27/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all-time high</a><strong style="color:#000"> </strong>and silver notched its highest level in seven years. What’s it mean? Not clear, because stocks are also gaining (and gold is considered a safe haven from riskier assets like stocks). </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Down </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">House protection: </strong>Under Armour said it <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/27/under-armour-shares-tumble-after-it-reveals-execs-received-wells-notice.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">received</a> a “Wells notice” from the Securities and Exchange Commission. That is not a get well card—it means the regulator plans to bring enforcement action against the company for its accounting and sales practices from 2015–2016, which are already under investigation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Toy stories: </strong>Hasbro reported a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/27/investing/hasbro-earnings/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">29% decrease in revenue</a> last quarter due to store closures, the delay of blockbuster movie releases, and other coronavirus-related challenges. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/two-baseball-games-canceled-covid19-outbreak-among-marlins?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Baseball Makes an Error
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Phillie Phanatic" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODcyL3BoaWxsaWVfcGhhbmF0aWMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Hunter Martin/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Miami Marlins’ home opener, slated to be played last night, was <a href="https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/29547211/two-mlb-games-postponed-marlins-outbreak?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">postponed</a> after at least 13 players and staff were infected with COVID-19. The Phillies/Yankees game was also postponed. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>Before the Marlins played the Phillies in Philadelphia on Sunday, a few Marlins players tested positive for COVID-19. Instead of canceling the rest of the series, Marlins players decided <a href="https://www.inquirer.com/phillies/miami-marlins-coronavirus-outbreak-phillies-mlb-season-20200727.html?utm_campaign=Philly.com+Sports+Twitter+Account&utm_medium=social&utm_source=t.co&cid=Philly.com+Sports+Twitter+Account&__twitter_impression=true&__twitter_impression=true&__twitter_impression=true&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">via a text group chat</a> to play their upcoming game. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Sounds like something that would be against the rules, but the MLB’s 113-page operations manual actually </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/darrenrovell/status/1287800460976500737?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">leaves it up to the teams</a></span><span> to decide what to do in the event of multiple positive tests. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The consequences </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Best case scenario: </strong>The infected Marlins personnel enter quarantine and prevent a league-wide health crisis.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Worst case scenario:</strong> The virus jumps from team to team (or has already) and the MLB is forced to <a href="https://ftw.usatoday.com/2020/07/mlb-marlins-covid-outbreak-2020-season?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cancel the season</a>. Which could put Nap Lajoie's single-season record of a .426 batting average in serious jeopardy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Unlike the NBA, NWSL, and other leagues, MLB rejected the idea of playing in a self-contained “bubble.” The NFL, which is expected to adopt a similar approach to MLB, <a href="https://sports.yahoo.com/mlbs-marlins-covid-19-crisis-165047595.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will be watching</a> baseball’s next steps very closely.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID-19
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/new-jersey-gym-owners-arrested-defying-state-health-mandate?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Gym Owners vs. New Jersey Ends in Cuffs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bellmawr gym weightlifting " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODc3L2JlbGxtYXdyX2d5bV93ZWlnaHRsaWZ0aW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mark Makela/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The anti-work-out-from-home New Jersey gym owners Ian Smith and Frank Trumbetti were arrested yesterday after <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/27/new-jersey-gym-owners-arrested-after-defying-coronavirus-order-we-will-not-be-backing-down.html?__source=twitter%7Cmain&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">violating</a> Governor Phil Murphy’s measures limiting the operations of certain nonessential businesses like gyms.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There's a reason we're writing about this particular location. Smith and Trumbetti have become <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-27/n-j-gym-owners-arrested-after-defying-governor-s-covid-order?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">national figures</a> in the battle between some small business owners and state officials over lockdown measures. They’ve made multiple appearances on Fox News to defend their decision to operate their gym despite restrictions. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Welcome to America 2020, where feeding your family and standing up for your constitutional rights is illegal,” a </span><span><a href="https://www.facebook.com/chrislambert163/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Facebook post</a></span><span> from the gym read yesterday. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The state of the fitness industry = not very fit. Subscription fitness platform Classpass said it lost <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/25/coronavirus-fitness-studios-gyms-move-classes-outdoors.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">95% of its revenue</a> in April, while iconic franchises Gold’s Gym and 24 Hour Fitness filed for bankruptcy during the pandemic. Governor Murphy recently allowed one-on-one training and some classes including pilates and yoga to resume, but is still keeping gyms closed.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook’s Social Media Stronghold
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<img alt="Facebook in the antitrust spotlight" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODY2L2ZhY2Vib29rX2luX3RoZV9hbnRpdHJ1c3Rfc3BvdGxpZ2h0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>The Brew is previewing tomorrow's antitrust hearing by profiling each Big Tech company at the table. Last but not least...</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Company: </strong>Facebook</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Volunteered as tribute: </strong>CEO Mark Zuckerberg</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The charges: </strong>Among many, regulators are concerned that Facebook’s repeated acquire-or-copy approach to up-and-comers in the social media space is stifling competition and limiting consumer choice. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The rebuttal: </strong>You're going after the wrong social media company, Congress. Facebook is actually a true American success story and the real threat is encroaching Chinese tech firms (see: ByteDance's TikTok). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/antitrust-spotlight-facebooks-social-media-stronghold?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read the full story</a> of Zuck vs. antitrust regulators. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Written by
<a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Neal Freyman</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/its_ahickey" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alex Hickey</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/jamiekaywilde" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jamie Wilde</a>, and <a href="https://twitter.com/tobydoyhowell" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Toby Howell</a>

style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSenate Republicans released their $1 trillion emergency relief package, and since you have to brand everything these days, they called it the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-congress/u-s-republicans-offer-coronavirus-aid-plan-face-bipartisan-opposition-idUSKCN24S148?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHEALS Act\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. It contains another round of $1,200 in direct payments and reduced additional unemployment benefits from the current $600/week. Keep in mind, it’s just a starting point for negotiations with Democrats. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCoronavirus: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInfections appear to be \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-26/u-s-hot-spots-get-reprieve-from-climbing-cases-virus-update?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslowing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in a few key states that have experienced major outbreaks: California, Florida, and Arizona.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCurrency: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. dollar \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/heres-what-a-falling-us-dollar-means-for-the-stock-market-2020-07-25?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to a two-year low yesterday. It’s tough to know what to make of that relative to stocks, which have been gaining as the dollar has dropped, but it likely means investors are less bullish on the U.S. economy than other countries.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTECH \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/google-extends-remote-policy-july-2021?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nGoogle’s Gonna Give It a Year\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Google logo on a couch\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODc1L2dvb2dsZV9sb2dvX29uX2FfY291Y2guanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoogle is letting employees \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-to-keep-employees-home-until-summer-2021-amid-coronavirus-pandemic-11595854201?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eremain remote\u003c/a\u003e until July 2021, a decision that will affect ~200,000 full-time and contract workers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBesides saving a small fortune on KIND Bars, CEO Sundar Pichai wanted to provide flexibility for working parents who may need to provide childcare this fall, and relocating employees who want to sign full-year leases in their mountain/beach town of choice. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwitter and Facebook committed to a more permanent remote workforce months ago, but Google is the first major company to extend its WFH timeline due to the resurgence in cases. And it won’t be the last. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBad news for business districts\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile NYC reopened offices for nonessential workers a month ago, fewer than 10% of Manhattan button-ups \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/one-month-later-few-manhattan-office-workers-have-returned-despite-new-yorks-reopening-11595847600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare back\u003c/a\u003e, per the WSJ. That emptiness feels especially profound in districts \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/26/nyregion/nyc-coronavirus-time-life-building.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elike Midtown\u003c/a\u003e, where offices that once welcomed 8,000 people/day now host just 500.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd when workers are home...they’re not spending money at Potbelly after giving up on the Sweetgreen line. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAbout a fourth of New York's office employers plan on reducing their office footprint by 20% or more, according to a Partnership for New York City study. Big cities’ losses could be a gain for small cities that have historically taken longer to recover from downturns. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStill, don’t bank on a mass exodus. \u003c/strong\u003eMost office leases are 8+ years, and many employers are trying hybrid approaches where employees still come in a couple days a week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA tempting alternative: According to the WSJ, video communications company OpenExchange is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/companies-start-to-think-remote-work-isnt-so-great-after-all-11595603397?mod=searchresults\u0026page=1\u0026pos=2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erenting a house\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the English countryside for its European employees to live and work out of. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCracks in the remote model\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile many companies went remote relatively smoothly, some execs are feeling cool about it long-term.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHiring and onboarding are more choppy. Company values are harder to instill remotely. Young employees are missing out on development and mentorship. And Justin has completely given up on hiding his pen during Zoom meetings.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRemote work also makes it more difficult for employers to root out bad behavior and ensure client confidentiality.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eother companies’ decisions could turn on the status of school reopenings and how quickly the recent spike in COVID-19 cases subsides.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Miami Marlins’ home opener, slated to be played last night, was \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/29547211/two-mlb-games-postponed-marlins-outbreak?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epostponed\u003c/a\u003e after at least 13 players and staff were infected with COVID-19. The Phillies/Yankees game was also postponed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eBefore the Marlins played the Phillies in Philadelphia on Sunday, a few Marlins players tested positive for COVID-19. Instead of canceling the rest of the series, Marlins players decided \u003ca href=\"https://www.inquirer.com/phillies/miami-marlins-coronavirus-outbreak-phillies-mlb-season-20200727.html?utm_campaign=Philly.com+Sports+Twitter+Account\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_source=t.co\u0026cid=Philly.com+Sports+Twitter+Account\u0026__twitter_impression=true\u0026__twitter_impression=true\u0026__twitter_impression=true\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evia a text group chat\u003c/a\u003e to play their upcoming game. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSounds like something that would be against the rules, but the MLB’s 113-page operations manual actually \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/darrenrovell/status/1287800460976500737?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleaves it up to the teams\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to decide what to do in the event of multiple positive tests. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe consequences \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBest case scenario: \u003c/strong\u003eThe infected Marlins personnel enter quarantine and prevent a league-wide health crisis.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWorst case scenario:\u003c/strong\u003e The virus jumps from team to team (or has already) and the MLB is forced to \u003ca href=\"https://ftw.usatoday.com/2020/07/mlb-marlins-covid-outbreak-2020-season?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecancel the season\u003c/a\u003e. Which could put Nap Lajoie's single-season record of a .426 batting average in serious jeopardy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eUnlike the NBA, NWSL, and other leagues, MLB rejected the idea of playing in a self-contained “bubble.” The NFL, which is expected to adopt a similar approach to MLB, \u003ca href=\"https://sports.yahoo.com/mlbs-marlins-covid-19-crisis-165047595.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill be watching\u003c/a\u003e baseball’s next steps very closely.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
